content.body: cool to see engine262 getting more mind share. i guess that project for evaluating the spec text didn't catch on?
esmeta? It's run as part of the 262 spec CI https://github.com/tc39/ecma262/blob/main/.github/workflows/esmeta-typecheck.yml
strictly speaking we only run the typechecker part of esmeta, not the actual evaluator
Same goes for call syntax, I think(which I previously made the same overlap comment about)
I have been meaning to fix this for a while. I actually started rewriting the asyncGC helper and the tests, but I really don't have much time to dedicate to this.
If someone is interested in taking over I can try to cleanup my old local experiment. Some tests do need to be rewritten to accommodate

Would any delegate be able to sponsor me as an invited expert (https://github.com/tc39/how-we-work/blob/main/invited-expert.md#joining-process) so I can continue championing my proposals? I’m leaving Indiana University, a TC39 member.

* Would any delegate be able to sponsor me as an invited expert (https://github.com/tc39/how-we-work/blob/main/invited-expert.md#joining-process) so I can continue championing/co-championing proposals? I’m leaving Indiana University, a TC39 member.
